project.teaser: Engage4BIO will strengthen circular, sustainable bioeconomy and sustainable regional development through engaging quadruple helix actors - taking into account their diversity of societal, economic and cultural perspectives from five regional bio-based systems (and five...
project.objective: Engage4BIO will strengthen circular, sustainable bioeconomy and sustainable regional development through engaging quadruple helix actors - taking into account their diversity of societal, economic and cultural perspectives from five regional bio-based systems (and five associated regions) in processes of design thinking, co-creation, (re)training and skills development. Based on their regional specificities (availability of biomass feedstock, level of technology, planetary boundaries and social capital) activities will be co-created, performed and (re-)shaped to their best advantage for each region. The regional bio-based systems focus on the five major value chains, namely circular and bio-based textiles (NL), agriculture and agro-food industries (HU), wood and interior (AT), bio-based and sustainable packaging (FI) and blue bioeconomy (IT). The embedding art and design in the activities the framework will boost the uptake to a) strengthen local governance feedback loops and respective governance models, b) to increase design thinking and co-create formats for training, retraining, mentoring and skills development and transfer fostering understanding and engagement in bio-based systems c) to co-create communication and awareness campaigns. The co-created and implemented activities result in fully open initiatives that advance skills transfer and development activities like (re-) training formats or mentoring programmes for various relevant stakeholders in bio-based value chains, and encourage the inclusion of citizen's knowledge and perception as well as the engagement of citizens, boosting a better-informed decision-making process and enhancing engagement and innovation. Thus, Engage4BIO framework will be designed in a transferable way, considering regional, natural and cultural differences and will be applicable in different European regions, also thanks to the involvement of networks and regions the partners include.
project.title: Better understanding, intensified engagement, training and development in regional bio-based systems
project.keywords: engagement, training, co-creation, art and culture, policy feedback loops, responsive government and society

article.title: Bio-based systems for sustainable regional development

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan including the developed toolkit
result.description: Developing Dissemination, Exploitation (Upscaling) and Communication Plan (D4.1) - using also the analysis of T2.2. The plan will identify what, when, why, to whom, how, where disseminate/upscale/exploit/communicate and who is in charge of such activities, including Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for assessing measures proposed and procedures and tools for reporting activities. D4.1 will also map and analyse projects, initiatives and networks to collaborate with in order to increase Engage4BIO impacts (representing the basis for activities implemented in T4.3): it will identify topics and project’s outputs on which cooperation could be based on; entities to be engaged,categorised according to their public relevance and network owned; common benefits acquired thanks to each collaboration.

result.title: Guideline for hubs: (1) the theoretical framework, (2) map and gap analysis, (3) activity catalogues for education, knowledge gain and (4) innovation processes
result.description: Establish Guidelines for hub activities including: (1) the theoretical framework, (2)map and gap analysis, (3) activity catalogues for education, knowledge gain and (4) innovation processes

result.title: Collection of co-created innovative art-integrated formats and activities on education, knowledge gain and innovative governance
result.description: Addressing and finding ways of how to manage regional bio-based innovation processes and how to ensure inclusiveness and engagement of all actors. Good practice guidelines for local operators and innovation developers on innovative governance models supporting particularly balanced local potentials and innovation (in terms of economy, society and ecology impact).

result.title: Data management plan, Open Science and protection strategy
result.description: This deliverable will provide details on the data handling and clarifies the processing of data during and after the project and will describe what data will be collected, processed or generated (incl. methodology and standards), shared and/or made openly available, how it will be curated and preserved.

result.title: Fisheries and aquaculture by-products modulate growth, body composition, and omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acid content in black soldier fly (Hermetia illucens) larvae

details.authors: Rosaria Arena1†, Simona Manuguerra1†, Eleonora Curcuraci1, Maria Cusimano2, Daniela Lo Monaco2, Calogero Di Bella2, Andrea Santulli1,3 and Concetta Maria Messina1*

result.title: Mapping results: Potentials, attitudes and boundaries in five bioeconomy hubs
result.description: The good practices collected in T1.3 will be revised, adapted and co-created for the region's needs and specificities in the workshop. Output: guidelines for training and mentoring for the specific value chains in the hubs, supportingthe boosting of knowledge and skills useful in the bioeconomy, and in particular bio-based sectors. Results will be collected in D2.2 and established as Open Educational Resource (bioeconomy learning hub), for retain, re-use and adaptation in bioeconomy.

category.title: Report Summary

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
